title: Quiz 7: Surgery Review (2021)
description: Compilation of available questions from February and July 2021 Surgery FQE papers. Covers Principles of Surgery, Trauma, Orthopaedics, and Urology.

questions.question: A reason for documenting patient's full names in clerkship is to:
questions.explanation: Patient identification is crucial for medical records management and legal purposes.

questions.question: In taking a surgical history:

options.text: Use of medical terms is advocated in history of presenting illness

questions.explanation: Occupational history helps identify risk factors (e.g., heavy lifting for hernias, standing for varicose veins).

questions.question: The best method of palpating the kidney is:
questions.explanation: The kidney is retroperitoneal; bimanual palpation (one hand front, one back) allows balloting.

questions.question: Definitive investigation in a patient with haematemesis is:
questions.explanation: OGD allows direct visualization and therapeutic intervention for the bleeding source.

questions.question: Which medical condition is associated with increased risk of perioperative infections?
questions.explanation: Hyperglycemia impairs neutrophil function, increasing surgical site infection risk.

questions.question: Surgery performed to correct a non-life threatening condition is referred to as:
questions.explanation: Elective surgery is planned in advance for non-emergencies.
questions.hint: You elect (choose) when to do it.

questions.question: Which drug is given preoperatively to prevent emesis?
questions.explanation: Metoclopramide is an antiemetic. Atropine reduces secretions.

questions.question: A middle aged man presents with diffuse swelling of the left leg associated with pain following a thorn prick. Temp 39.0Â°C. Most likely diagnosis?
questions.explanation: Spreading bacterial infection of skin/subcutaneous tissue after minor trauma is Cellulitis.

questions.question: A female patient weighing 60 kg has 35% burns. Using the Parkland formula (4ml x kg x %TBSA), calculate the fluid for the FIRST 8 HOURS in ml.
questions.explanation: Total = 4 x 60 x 35 = 8,400 ml. First 8 hours = 50% = 4,200 ml.

questions.question: Which is a characteristic of a direct inguinal hernia?
questions.explanation: Direct hernias have a wide neck and reduce easily.

questions.question: Calculate GCS: Opens eyes to pain, utters inappropriate words, abnormal flexion (decorticate).
Most appropriate treatment for a severely displaced olecranon fracture is:
questions.explanation: Tension band wiring counteracts the pull of the triceps muscle.
questions.hint: Wiring to hold against muscle pull.

questions.question: 'Soap bubble' appearance on X-ray is a feature of:
questions.explanation: Classic appearance of Giant Cell Tumour in the epiphysis.

questions.question: Match the features to either Rheumatoid Arthritis (RA) or Osteoarthritis (OA).

pairs.right: RA: Spares DIPs | OA: Affects DIPs (Heberden's)

questions.explanation: RA is inflammatory/autoimmune affecting proximal joints. OA is wear-and-tear affecting weight-bearing and distal joints.
questions.hint: RA is systemic inflammation; OA is mechanical wear.

questions.question: Select five medical indications for Male Circumcision.
questions.explanation: Hypospadias is a contraindication (foreskin needed for repair). Others are valid indications.
questions.hint: Reasons related to infection, cancer, and tight foreskin.

questions.question: Arrange the management steps for Tension Pneumothorax.

items.text: Insert Intercostal Chest Tube (5th ICS MAL)

questions.explanation: Immediate decompression converts tension to simple pneumothorax. Definitive treatment is the chest tube.

questions.question: Case Study: 60yo male, acute inability to pass urine (8 hours), restless, tender suprapubic mass. Select correct Diagnosis, Causes, and Management.

richContent.content:
Patient: 60yo Male.
Symptoms: Inability to void for 8 hours, Pain.
Signs: Restless, Tender Suprapubic Mass (Palpable Bladder).

options.text: Immediate Mgmt: Suprapubic Cystostomy (if catheter fails)

questions.explanation: Classic presentation of Acute Urinary Retention likely due to BPH in an elderly male. Immediate relief via catheter is required.

questions.question: Select the clinical features of Infantile Hypertrophic Pyloric Stenosis (IHPS).
questions.explanation: Obstruction is proximal to the bile duct, so vomiting is non-bilious. Baby is hungry because food doesn't pass.

questions.question: Regarding Posterior Hip Dislocation (Trauma), select the correct statements.

options.text: Limb is Shortened, Adducted, Internally Rotated

questions.explanation: It is an orthopedic emergency to reduce the hip and prevent AVN. The limb position is classic (SAIR).

questions.question: The surgical term for excision/removal of an organ ends with the suffix:
questions.explanation: Ectomy means removal (e.g., Appendectomy).
